comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3420) (MYAIR-3835)
# 1. When the patient goes to the coaching section for the first time on a given phone then Monte Carlo shall ask the patient for permission to enable push notifications
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. ( https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

# Note 3: When testing manually, after the test steps, sign into the support website from Note 1, and check that the push token is there if the scenario has enabled push notifications. If the scenario has not enabled push notifications, the push token should not be there.
# Note 4: If the patient chooses to enable push notifications then both Coaching and Cleaning Reminder push notifications are to be enabled.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: After installing the app, go to the "Coaching" screen, enable push notifications and verify the system dialog to request permission displays

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I tap the "OK" button
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I should not see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I see the "Push notifications Coaching" is turned on
I see the "Push notifications Cleaning Reminder" is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-510) (MYAIR-3128)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support
# 2. The user shall be able to select a category, subcategory and question for the help request
# 3. When the user has selected a category, subcategory and question, Monte Carlo shall provide a link to the relevant support section.
# 4. The user shall be able to enter a description for the help request
# 5. The description shall be limited to 400 characters
# 6. When the user has chosen a category, subcategory, question, and written at least one character in the description, they shall be able to submit the help request
# 7. When the user has submitted the help request, Monte Carlo shall send the user's help request, first name, email address and FG serial number to Patient Portal
# Note: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Support+screen+improvement
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# note: this behaviour is because the support service can not answer treatment or therapy related queries.
# https://confluence.ec2.local/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=39259556

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support and have various items to select in Subcategory for Equipment Category

steps.name: I open the app on the "Settings" screen
I tap the "myAir Support" item
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I should be on the "Contact support" screen
I pick "Equipment" for the "Category" field
there should be the option "My mask" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "My CPAP machine" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "My humidifier" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "My air tubing" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "Cleaning and replacement" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "Traveling with CPAP" in the "Subcategory" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |

# |                |                                         | youâ€™ll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when running 1 minute of therapy, applicable message appears, then verify the previous sleep record that has 6 hour 59 minutes of data

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Keep going Jane!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out support. Try the myAir Library in the Coaching tab, or talk to your clinician." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out support. Try the myAir Library in the Coaching tab, or talk to your clinician.

steps.name: I navigate to 1 day back
I should see the value "That's a great score!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "You're well on your way to improving your health." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: You're well on your way to improving your health.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-611) (MYAIR-1120)
# 1. When Monte Carlo receives a HTTP 601 response from Patient Portal, the user shall be instructed to update their app
# 2. When Monte Carlo receives a HTTP 601 response, the user shall be blocked from using the app
# 3. The user shall be given a link to the app store
#Note: A.C-3 for android : The user shall be given a link to the google play store
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-896)
# 1. If a server error is received from Patient Portal, Monte Carlo shall inform the user that a server error occurred.
# note: server error is HTTP code 500
# 2. When the user dismisses the server error message, they shall be returned to the screen they were viewing when the error occurred.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-795)
# 1. If a server error is received from Patient Portal, Monte Carlo shall inform the user that a server error occurred.
# Note 1: "myAir Support" button is for iOS but for Android is "FAQs"
# Note 2: server error is HTTP code 500
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-1629)
# 1. If a server maintenance error is received from Patient Portal, Monte Carlo shall inform the user that the server is unavailable due to maintenance.
#    note: server error is HTTP code 503
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-2052)
# 1. If a server maintenance error is received from Patient Portal, Monte Carlo shall inform the user that the server is unavailable due to maintenance.
#     note: server error is HTTP code 503
# 2. When the user dismisses the server error message, they shall be returned to the screen they were viewing when the error occurred.
# NOTE: For iOS we have "More" screen and for android is "Settings" screen

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives a HTTP 601 response from Patient Portal on Coaching screen, the user shall be instructed to update their app

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "601"
Push notifications are enabled
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I should see the "instructions to update the app" item
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I close the app
I open the app
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives a HTTP 601 response from Patient Portal on My notifications, the user shall be instructed to update their app

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "601"
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I should see the "instructions to update the app" item
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I close the app
I open the app
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen

name: App Deprecation and Server Error from Patient Portal

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-88) (MYAIR-2973)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the number of Mask On/Offs for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the number of Mask On/Offs for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the Mask On/Off score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to see number of Mask ON/OFF for less than 30 nights.

steps.name: I have "13" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "On/off history" button
I should see the "Mask On/Off History" values for 13 days

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1635) (MYAIR-3650)

# 1. If Monte Carlo does not have internet connection, when the user attempts an action that requires internet connection to complete, then the user shall be notified that the server could not be reached and they should check their internet connection

# 2. If the user performs an action that requires Patient Portal to be responsive and Patient Portal does not respond, the user shall be notified that the server could not be reached and they should try again later
# Note: for coaching, these should only be shown when the user explicitly attempts to refresh the timeline, which in the current implementation is a pull down to refresh
# Test Note 1: "More" screen on iOS device myAir app is considered the same as "Settings" screen on Android device myAir app
# Test Note 2 (For Scenarios 15-28): On iOS device: Navigate to Settings/Developer/Networking/Network Link Conditioner/Enable (ON)
# Test Note 3 (For Scenarios 15-28): Select 100% Loss profile to simulate: 'Patient Portal Server not responding'
# Test Note 4 (For Scenarios 15-28): Wait approximately 15 to 30 seconds for Patient Portal Server to not to respond and eventually timeout
# Test Note 5 "I enable airplane mode" is consider to be no Internet connection (Wifi/Cellular/Other)

elements.name: The user does not have an internet connection and tries to update patient info in "About me" screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I enter "fooBarBaz" into the "First name" field
I enable airplane mode
I tap the "Save" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user tries to refresh his/her coaching timeline

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
I open the app on the "Coaching Timeline" screen
I wait for coaching sync
Patient Portal requests will time out
I refresh the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Server error" dialog

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user navigates to "My equipment" screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal requests will time out
I navigate to the "My equipment" screen
I should see the "Server error" dialog
I tap the "OK" button
I should be on the "My equipment" screen

name: No internet or Patient Portal Connection

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRTIERIA: (MCA-2964) (MYAIR-3774)
#  1. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email coaching notifications.
#  2. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS coaching notifications.
#  3. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push coaching notifications.
#  4. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email cleaning reminder notifications.
#  5. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS cleaning reminder notifications.
#  6. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push cleaning reminder notifications.

#  7. If SMS notifications are turned on and the user does not have a phone number in their profile, the user shall be required to enter a phone number (note: see MYAIR-1287/MCA-701 for phone number confirmation requirements)
# Note 1 :  All test scenarios in this feature file require using Patient Portal server
# Note 2 : "More" screen for iOS is similar to "Settings" screen for android
# Note 3 : "Verify" screen for iOS is similar to "VERIFY" screen for android
# For Cleaning Reminders
# Note 4: The account for this test should have a Phone Number associated with the account
# Note 5: Reference page for Cleaning reminders: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library
# Note 6: Reference page for Cleaning reminders of notification settings: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/myAir+Notification+Settings
# Note 7: Cleaning Reminders - how to trigger events - https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Cleaning+and+replacement+reminders

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

I toggle the "SMS coaching" switch on
I toggle the "Email coaching" switch on
I navigate back to the "Profile" screen
I tap the "Sign out icon" button
I tap the "Sign out" button
I sign in with this account on another mobile device
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I see "Email coaching" is turned on
I see "SMS coaching" is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify if the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in the profile.

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the "Cell phone" field
I should see the value "5555555555" in the "Cell phone" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when user enters no confirmation code proper error message will appear

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I press "Verify"
I see the "Invalid code" text

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify the user is able to delete the phone number

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I tap the "Delete phone" button
I should be on the "About me" screen
I should not see the "Cell phone" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3350) (MYAIR-3791)
#1.Â  When a forthcoming scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient of the impending server outage
#2.Â  When a scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is down for scheduled maintenance
#3.Â  When an unscheduled partial outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 1: Occurs when AVX is down but Patient Portal is online
#4.Â  When an unscheduled outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 2:Â Occurs when Patient Portal is down or Patient Portal is unable to process App service request because AVX is down
#  Server notifies App of planned/unplanned outage, 4 different UI dialogs can appear for the 7 possible scenarios:
#  Dialog #1 (planned active)
#  1) PP planned outage active
#  2) AV planned outage active
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #2 (partial outage)
#  3) AV unplanned outage
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #3 (total outage)
#  4) PP unplanned outage
#  5) AV unplanned outage which prevents PP from completing any part of request
#  Note: string hard-coded in App
#  Dialog #4 (planned upcoming)
#  6) PP planned outage upcoming
#  7) AV planned outage upcoming
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
# Notes: For Android testing purposes use these to generate the Outages
#AC 1: Dialog 4: Planned outage Upcoming - Scheduled Full Outage / Scheduled Partial Outage
#AC 2: Dialog 1: Planned Active Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 3: Dialog 2: Unplanned Partial Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 4: Dialog 3: Unplanned Total Outage - Active Full Outage (this is just 503/404 HTTP Response )
# Reference page: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Monaco+Interface+with+Patient+Portal#MonacoInterfacewithPatientPortal-ServerOutages

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: The user should receive "Planned Active Outage" notification when Patient Portal send the notification to the user

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal has a "scheduled partial" active outage
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I should see the "myAir is currently experiencing technical difficulties. You may experience a delay in receiving new sleep data" dialog

arguments.val: myAir is currently experiencing technical difficulties. You may experience a delay in receiving new sleep data

comments.value: # Mock for Android (Planned Active Outage) : Set HTTP: HTTP_OK /  Outage Notification >> "Active Partial Outage"

elements.name: The user should receive "Planned Active Outage" notification when Patient Portal send the notification to the user during support submission

steps.name: I open the app on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I input valid information in all "Contact support" fields
Patient Portal has a "scheduled partial" active outage
I tap the "Submit" button
I should see the "myAir is currently experiencing technical difficulties. You may experience a delay in receiving new sleep data" dialog

arguments.val: myAir is currently experiencing technical difficulties. You may experience a delay in receiving new sleep data

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# Note 1: "More" screen is for iOS and for android is "Settings"

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a message to contact their care provider when asked clinically related question in the support form

steps.name: I open the app on the "Contact support" screen
I pick "Data" for the "Category" field
I pick "myAir score" for the "Subcategory" field
I pick "What does events per hour mean?" for the "Questions" field

arguments.val: What does events per hour mean?

steps.name: I should see the "Contact your healthcare provider" web view text
